message.content:
cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper focuses on enabling robots to communicate their objectives to end-users, which falls under the category of robotics (cs.RO). The approach involves using inverse reinforcement learning (IRL) to model how humans infer objectives from observed behavior, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The user study conducted to analyze the effectiveness of the approach involves human-robot interaction, which is a key area of research in human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also introduces two factors to define candidate approximate-inference models for human learning, which involves statistical analysis and machine learning techniques (cs.LG). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of enabling robots to communicate their objectives in novel situations, which is a key challenge in the field of autonomous systems (cs.SY).
